question: Many students find it difficult to concentrate or pay attention in school. What are the reasons? What could be done to solve this problem?
text: In this contemporary world, academic training plays a crucial part in the development of every child and it is necessary for children to take studying seriously. Despite that, a number of pupils complain that it is extremely difficult to stay focused in class. The aim of this essay is to elucidate various factors of this phenomenon as well as to offer some practical remedies.

To commence with, there are myriad aspects that contribute to the reduced attention span of students. First of all, many pupils blame the fact that academic training sessions in recent years have become considerably duller, to the point of lacking any sort of enjoyment. Hence, an increasing number of scholars begin to lose interest in school. Another widely recognised cause of this tendency is that a plethora of children are forced to study subjects that they could not care less about. To illustrate, it is highly unlikely that a pupil who is blessed with artistic talent would have as much enthusiasm in mathematics class as in art one.

Fortunately, a wide range of remedies can be applied in hope of ameliorating this ongoing situation. Firstly, educators should attempt to present their lessons in a more interesting and captivating approach. For instance, movies and books can be utilized to not only provide information on specific fields but also to attract the attention of scholars, which may improve students' ability to absorb knowledge. In addition, it may be advisable for the curriculum to be altered with the purpose of allowing pupils to learn subjects that they are fond of. If that were to happen, the lack of concentration in classes might experience a significant alleviation.

In conclusion, the boring aspect of lessons and the lack of enthusiasm for specific courses appear to be the prominent culprits behind the decreasing attentiveness of scholars. Therefore, appropriate measures, for example, elevating entertainment in the classroom and granting children the choice of following which courses they desire, should be implemented in order to successfully tackle this predicament.
